results.title: Young guns II (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Morgan Creek, Paul Schiff, Irby Smith and Geoff Murphy
results.brief_description: Hollywood’s most wanted men return in a blaze of glory to shake the west once again. Down, but definitely not out, the three surviving members of the infamous Regulators, Billy the Kid, (Emilio Estevez), Josiah ‘Doc’ Scurlock, (Kiefer Sutherland), and Chavez Y. Chavez, (Lou Diamond Phillips), reunite for their greatest adventure. Joined by his pal Arkansas Dave Rudabaugh, (Christian Slater), and two unlikely recruits, Billy is as reckless and irreverent as ever as he rounds up his new gang and heads for the west. But things have changed since the Regulators last rode through. The Kid is cornered by ruthless cattle kings and double-crossed by corrupt officials. Tracked by his one-time friend - the newly appointed sheriff, Pat Garrett - the Kid leads the Regulators down a treacherous trail towards Old Mexico… and to their destiny.

results.title: Young Einstein (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Serious Productions, Warwick Ross, David Roach and Yahoo Serious
results.brief_description: A comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock ‘n roll. Albert Einstein sails the world, falls in love with the world’s most intelligent and beautiful girl, Marie Curie, creates the first surfboard, invents the electric guitar and uses rock ‘n roll to save the planet from atomic destruction. Virtually a one-man tour de force by Yahoo Serious and co-starring Odile le Clezio.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.title: Young and Innocent = a Girl Was Young
results.creator_credit: GFD, Gainsborough Pictures, Edward Black and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: A mysterious man with a twitch in his eye; a young woman’s body washed ashore along with the raincoat belt used to strangle her; the supposedly innocent owner of the raincoat, fleeing from the police and frantically seeking the real murderer - all these elements combine to produce a full-speed, nail-biting mystery melodrama from the master of suspense, Alfred Hitchcock. Based on the novel A shilling for candles by Josephine Tey.

results.title: You were never lovelier
results.creator_credit: Columbia Pictures, Louis F. Edelman and William A. Seiter
results.brief_description: Fred Astaire and Rita Hayworth dance up a storm in this classic musical romance set in Buenos Aires. Maria (Hayworth) is the coolly elegant, eldest daughter of hotel magnate Edward Acuna, the most opinionated man in South America. Having inherited her father’s misanthropy, Maria has created havoc for her two sisters who can’t wed until she marries a man of Acuna’s choice. Along comes Robert Davies (Astaire), a carefree American dancer, down on his luck in Argentina. Unfortunately for Davies, Acuna can’t stand him, especially when he’s dancing around the hotel and chasing after his lovely daughter.

results.title: You can count on me
results.creator_credit: Shooting Gallery, Cappa Productions, Hart Sharp Entertainment, Barbara de Fina, Jeffrey Sharp, Larry Meistrich, John N. Hart and Kenneth Lonergan
results.brief_description: You can count on me is a family reunion drama that contains impressive performances full of nuance and has an adroit observational tone. The original screenplay (by director Kenneth Lonergan) veers away from cliche and pat conclusions, imbuing the characters with a realistic quality. Sammy and Terry are orphaned at a young age when their parents are killed in a car accident. As adults, the siblings are estranged, having made divergent choices. Sammy is a single parent with an eight-year-old son, Rudy, living in the house she was brought up in, working in a bank. She lives by a strict moral code, bound by religion and duty, but is entirely capable of hypocrisy and self-delusion. Terry, by contrast, is a wild loner, full of rage, self-destructive by nature but charming in his own humorous way. He doesn’t believe in Sammy’s ordered conservative life and inadvertently challenges this, creating chaos with his presence. It is Terry and Rudy’s strengthening relationship that acts as a catalyst, causing an irrevocable torrent of truths that upend the family dynamics. The personal and familial dilemmas contained within the script are identifiable and the film sensitively deals with themes of oppression and personal choice. Cast includes: Laura Linney, Matthew Broderick, Mark Ruffalo, Rory Culkin.

results.title: You can't take it with you
results.brief_description: Meet the Vanderhofs - the zaniest, happiest family ever to grace the screen. They have a simple philosophy for living “Nothing is worth doing if you can’t enjoy it - and when it’s over you can’t take it with you”. Head of this eccentric clan is Grandpa, (Lionel Barrymore) who has decided to devote the rest of his life to having fun because he has enough money. Matters become complicated when his granddaughter (Jean Arthur) falls in love with James Stewart, son of a tycoon (Edward Arnold), who wants the Vanderhof property to expand his business. Wholesome, homespun, appealing and touching this screwball Capra comedy won two Academy Awards in 1938 for Best Picture and Best Direction.

results.title: You've got mail
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Lauren Shuler and Nora Ephron
results.brief_description: This story brings romance and courtship (as well as Meg Ryan, Tom Hanks and director Nora Ephron for the third time) into the age of the World Wide Web via email and chat rooms. Joe and Kathleen have a lot in common, they live near each other, they are both in the publishing industry, he in supersized book department stores - Foxbooks, and she in a small independent one - Shop Around the Corner, they even buy coffee at the same place. They have not met in person as yet, but they have met one another in a chat room where they bare their thoughts about life, work and their significant others who are less than perfect. Pretty soon NY152 and Shop Girl want to meet in person, which leads to inevitable angst when two soul mates discover they are business rivals. Cast also includes Parker Posey and Greg Kinnear.

results.title: Yojimbo [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Toho Kabushiki Kaisha and Akira Kurosawa
results.brief_description: A fine film by Kurosawa, in which a wandering samurai exploits two gangs who are fighting for control of a village. Very much a tongue-in-cheek samurai film, with Toshiro Mifune quite superb as the warrior who teaches both warring factions a lesson. Reverred for its black humour and technical mastery, “Yojimbo”, like many of Kurosawa’s works, was later remade — by Sergio Leone, as “A fistful of dollars”. Also available on VHS [301894].

results.title: Yesterday, today and tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Compagnia Cinematografica Champion Films Concordia, Paris and Vittorio De Sica
results.brief_description: Sophia Loren and Marcello Mastroianni appear in three separate stories. In the first, Adelina (Loren) is a blackmarket slum marketeer who remains permanently pregnant in order to escape a jail sentence, much to the consternation of her exhausted husband (Mastroianni). In the second, Anna, the elegant wife of a rich Milan industrialist, meets her lover for a secret rendezvous. In the third, Mara is a call girl having an affair with a Bologna playboy. Saucy entertainment from two of the best actors to come out of Italy, this film confirmed Loren’s and Mastroianni’s success as international sex symbols. Dubbed in English.
